value.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Edge
value.excerpt: Explain the essential characteristics of the IoT Edge and the functionality of the IoT Edge components (modules, runtime, and cloud interface). Characterize the types of problems that you can solve with IoT Edge.  Describe how the elements of IoT Edge can be combined to solve the problem of deploying IoT applications in the cloud.

images.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Edge

value.title: Introduction to Python using the datascience library
value.excerpt: Learn about programming and data types in Python

images.title: Introduction to Python using the datascience library

value.title: Introduction to Azure Data Lake storage
value.excerpt: Learn how Azure Data Lake Storage provides a cloud storage service that is highly available, secure, durable, scalable, and redundant and brings new efficiencies to processing big data analytics workloads.

images.title: Introduction to Azure Data Lake storage

value.title: Create and deploy Logic Apps using Azure Resource Manager templates
value.excerpt: Define a Logic Apps workflow declaratively as a Resource Manager template and deploy the app using the Azure Command Line Interface (CLI).

images.title: Create and deploy Logic Apps using Azure Resource Manager templates

value.title: Enable identity protection in Microsoft 365
value.excerpt: Learn about Azure Active Directory (AD) Identity Protection and ways to optimize the end-user experience while benefiting security.

value.title: Maintain a secure repository by using GitHub best practices
value.excerpt: Learn best practices for building, hosting, and maintaining a secure repository on GitHub.

images.title: Maintain a secure repository by using GitHub best practices

value.title: Discuss practices for responsible AI at Microsoft
value.excerpt: At Microsoft, we have established our own governing practices for responsible AI. While every organization will have its own approach and we don’t have all the answers, we’d like to share what we’ve learned so far.

images.title: Discuss practices for responsible AI at Microsoft

value.title: Planning for implementing SAP solutions on Azure
value.excerpt: In this module, you will review the SAP supported VM and HLI types, the OS and DBMS releases for SAP in Azure, and the SAPS throughput estimates provided by Azure VMs and HLI.

images.title: Planning for implementing SAP solutions on Azure

value.title: Prepare to migrate SAP workloads to Azure
value.excerpt: In this module, you will walk through the important steps required for deploying SAP workloads to Azure. The steps include project preparation, pilot, non-production, production preparation, go-live, and post production.

images.title: Prepare to migrate SAP workloads to Azure

value.title: Publish a web app to Azure with Visual Studio
value.excerpt: Use the publishing features of Visual Studio 2017 to deploy and manage an ASP.NET Core web application hosted on Azure.

images.title: Publish a web app to Azure with Visual Studio

value.title: Publish and manage your APIs with Azure API Management
value.excerpt: Use API management to control who uses your APIs, to enforce usage policies, and to present a professional front-end to developers using the API.

images.title: Publish and manage your APIs with Azure API Management

value.title: Object-oriented programming in Python
value.excerpt: Learn more about object-oriented programming with this next-steps module in Python.

images.title: Object-oriented programming in Python

value.title: Recognize and synthesize speech
value.excerpt: Learn how to recognize and synthesize speech by using Azure Cognitive Services.

images.title: Recognize and synthesize speech

value.title: Identify governing practices for responsible AI
value.excerpt: As AI becomes more prevalent, it’s imperative that organizations have governing practices in place to ensure that it’s used responsibly. Responsible use of AI starts with organizations establishing their own guiding principles, then choosing and operationalizing a system of governance. We recognize that every organization will have their own perspective on responsible AI, but we’re hopeful that our perspective will serve as a helpful starting point as others embark on their own AI journey.

images.title: Identify governing practices for responsible AI

value.title: Route system feedback to development teams
value.excerpt: Learn how continuous monitoring and dashboards give you insight into how customers use your software and where patterns of failure occur.

images.title: Route system feedback to development teams

value.title: Run functional tests in Azure Pipelines
value.excerpt: Run Selenium UI tests, a form of functional testing, in Azure Pipelines.

images.title: Run functional tests in Azure Pipelines

value.title: Secure your application by using OpenID Connect and Azure AD
value.excerpt: Use OpenID Connect in your application to allow users to securely sign in with Azure AD identities.

images.title: Secure your application by using OpenID Connect and Azure AD

value.title: Store and Access NoSQL Data with Azure Cosmos DB and the Table API
value.excerpt: Get lower latency, higher availability, and easier scaling by moving your Azure Storage Tables application to Azure Cosmos DB.

images.title: Store and Access NoSQL Data with Azure Cosmos DB and the Table API

value.title: Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
value.excerpt: Data-flow diagrams are graphical representations of your system and should specify each element, their interactions and helpful context.

images.title: Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements

value.title: Use a Framework to Identify Threats and Find Ways to Reduce or Eliminate Risk
value.excerpt: Threat modeling helps you generate a list of potential threats using the threat modeling framework and find ways to reduce or eliminate risk with corresponding security controls.

images.title: Use a Framework to Identify Threats and Find Ways to Reduce or Eliminate Risk
Use a Framework to Identify Threats and Find Ways to Reduce or Eliminate Risk

value.title: Troubleshoot inbound network connectivity for Azure Load Balancer
value.excerpt: Review multidimensional metrics for the load balancer in Azure Monitor Metrics, and check health probe status for the load balancer.

images.title: Troubleshoot inbound network connectivity for Azure Load Balancer

value.title: Working with Compute Contexts in Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: One of the key benefits of the cloud is the ability to use scalable, on-demand compute resources for cost-effective processing of large data. In this module, you'll learn how to use cloud compute in Azure Machine Learning to run training experiments at scale.

value.title: Using IAAS support with Azure for SAP workloads
value.excerpt: There are many SAP-certified operating systems supported by SAP running on Azure VMs. In this module, you will review the SAP recommended support products for VM types and the network, database, and monitoring requirements.

images.title: Using IAAS support with Azure for SAP workloads

value.title: Utilize Azure for SAP workloads reference architecture
value.excerpt: In this module, you will review the Azure infrastructure options for hosting SAP NetWeaver and S/4HANA systems in Azure. You will examine the differences between the offerings of traditional outsourcers and IaaS offerings.

images.title: Utilize Azure for SAP workloads reference architecture

value.title: Working with Data in Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Data is the foundation of machine learning. In this module, you will learn how to work with datastores and datasets in Azure Machine Learning, enabling you to build scalable, cloud-based model training solutions.

value.title: Automate tasks in SQL Server
value.excerpt: Scripting repetitive tasks in Azure SQL for regular maintenance jobs and multi-instance administration. Automation of error and resource alerts. Configuration of notifications for failures.

topItems.title: Configure automatic deployment for Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Utilize Azure Resource Manager templates for deploying Azure SQL resources.

topItems.title: Schedule tasks using SQL Server Agent
topItems.excerpt: Explore SQL automation for scheduled tasks and automatic alerts for SQL Server and Managed Instance. Configure extended event sessions for tracing activities.

topItems.title: Manage Azure PaaS resources using automated methods
topItems.excerpt: Explore SQL automation for Azure SQL Database and Open Source databases. Configure elastic jobs and Azure Policy.

value.title: Automate your deployments with Azure DevOps learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to combine automation techniques such as infrastructure as code with automated pipelines to provision and configure the infrastructure you need to run your applications and services.

topItems.title: Provision infrastructure in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Learn how infrastructure as code enables you to describe and automatically provision the infrastructure that you need for your application.

topItems.title: Configure infrastructure in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Run configuration management tools in Azure Pipelines to help keep your infrastructure configured as you need.

images.title: Configure infrastructure in Azure Pipelines

topItems.title: Provision databases in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to automatically provision Azure SQL Database in Azure Pipelines by using an Azure Resource Manager template.

images.title: Provision databases in Azure Pipelines

value.title: Build the intelligent edge with Azure IoT Edge
value.excerpt: Interested in building end to end IoT solutions or about Azure IoT, but aren't quite sure what it can do for you? This path is the place to start.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Edge
topItems.excerpt: Explain the essential characteristics of the IoT Edge and the functionality of the IoT Edge components (modules, runtime, and cloud interface). Characterize the types of problems that you can solve with IoT Edge.  Describe how the elements of IoT Edge can be combined to solve the problem of deploying IoT applications in the cloud.

images.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Edge

topItems.title: Deploy a prebuilt module to the Edge device
topItems.excerpt: Deploy a pre-built temperature simulator module to the edge using a container. The pre-built module will be deployed to an IoT edge device. You will check that the module was successfully created and deployed to the edge. You will view the simulated data from the deployed module.

images.title: Deploy a prebuilt module to the Edge device

topItems.title: Set up an IoT Edge Gateway
topItems.excerpt: This module is theoretical and will walk you through how an IoT Edge device can be used as a gateway.

images.title: Set up an IoT Edge Gateway
Introduction to Azure IoT Edge

value.title: Capture feedback and monitoring data to continuously improve your software learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure release pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications.

topItems.excerpt: Learn how surveys and application analytics create a feedback loop that helps you understand the voice of the customer.

images.title: Recommend and design system feedback mechanisms
